content_blocks.title: Attack Simulation

content.scenario: You've compromised a domain controller and extracted credentials. Time for persistence.
steps: Gather domain SID and domain name
Forge TGT with desired privileges (Domain Admin)
Access any resource in the domain
detection: Monitor for tickets with unusual lifetimes (10 years)
Track tickets created outside normal KDC processes
Alert on tickets for disabled accounts

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: Follow this attack path step-by-step to understand the adversary perspective.
content_blocks.real_world_connection: This exact attack path has been observed in real breaches.
content_blocks.reflection_prompt: How would you detect each step of this attack?

post_assessment.question: What is required to create a Golden Ticket?
post_assessment.explanation: The KRBTGT account hash is used to forge TGTs, creating a Golden Ticket with domain admin privileges.

post_assessment.question: Why are Golden Tickets dangerous?
post_assessment.explanation: Golden Tickets provide persistent domain access and survive password resets (except KRBTGT rotation).

post_assessment.question: How do you remediate a Golden Ticket attack?
post_assessment.explanation: KRBTGT must be rotated TWICE (maintains two password versions) to invalidate all Golden Tickets.
